gurmukhi: ijh cqur kuMf ijiqE dubwr ] Arjn BImwid BRwqw juJwr ]12]137]
transliteration: Jih Chatur Kound Jitio Doubaar|| Arjan Bheemaadh Bhraataa Jujhaar||12||137||
translation: He conquered twice all the four directions. The mighty warriors like Arjuna and Bhim were his brothers.12.137.

gurmukhi: Arjn piTE au`qr idswn ] BImih krwie pUrb pXwn ]
transliteration: Arjan Pathio Outtar Disaan|| Bheemah(i) Karaae Poorab Payaan||
translation: He sent Arjuna toward the North for conquest, Bhim went for conquest to the east.

gurmukhi: sihdyv piTE d`Kx su dys ] nuklih pTwie p`Cm p√çys ]13]138]
transliteration: Sah(i) Dev Pathio Dakkhan Su Des|| Nouklah(i) Pathaae Pachcham Praves||13||138||
translation: Sahdev was sent to the country in the South, Nakul was sent to the West.13.138.

gurmukhi: mMfy mhIp KMifE KqRwx ] ij`qy AjIq mMfy mhwn ]
transliteration: Mande Maheep Khandio Khatraan|| Jitte Ajeet Mande Mahaan||
translation: The Kshatriya kings were mashed and destroyed. In the Great war the unconquerable were conquered.

gurmukhi: KMifE su auqR Kurwswn dys ] d`Kx pUrb jIqy nrys ]14]139]
transliteration: Khandio Su Outra Khuraasaan Des|| Dakkhan Poorab Jeete Dares||14||139||
translation: The Khorasan country in the North was destroyed, The kings of the South and East were conquered.14.139.

gurmukhi: Kg KMf KMf jIqy mhIp ] b`ijE inswn ieh jMbU dIp ]
transliteration: Khag Khanndjeete Maheep|| Bajjio Nisaan Eh Janboo Deep||
translation: The kings of all the regions were defeated with the might of sword. In this Jambu Dvipa the trumpet (of Yudhishtra sounded.

gurmukhi: iek Taur kIey sB dys rwau ] mK rwjsUA ko kIE cwau ]15]140]
transliteration: Ik Thaur Keee Sabh Des Raau|| Mkh Raajsooa Ko Keeo Chaau||15||140||
translation: He gathered together the kings of various countries at one place. He expressed his wish for th performance of Rajsu sacrifice.15.140.

gurmukhi: sB dys dys pTy su pqR ] ijq ijq gunwF kIey iekqR ]
transliteration: Sabh Des Des Pathe Su Patra|| Jit Jit Gounaadh Keee Ikatra||
translation: He sent letters to all countries. All the qualified Brahmins were gathered together.

gurmukhi: mK rwjsUA ko kIXo ArMB ] niRp bhu bulwie ijqy AsMB ]16]141]
transliteration: Makh Raajsooa Ko Keeyo Aranbh|| Nrip Bahu Bulaae Jite Asanbh||16||141||
translation: The performance of Rajsu sacrifice was started. Many of the conquered kings were called.16.141.

gurmukhi: koit koit bulwie ir`qj koit bHm bulwie ]
transliteration: Kottee Kottee Bulaae Rittaj Kottee Brahm Bulaae||
translation: Million of ritual-conscious Brahmins were called.

gurmukhi: koit koit bnwie ibMjn BogIAih bhu Bwie ]
transliteration: Kottee Kottee Banaae Binjan Bhoteeah(i) Bahu Bhaae||
translation: Million of different foods were prepared which were enjoyed with relish.

gurmukhi: j`qR q`qR smgRkw khUM lwg hY niRprwie ]
transliteration: Jattra Tattra Samgrakaa Kahoon Laag Hai Nripraae||
translation: Many chief Sovereigns were busy in collecting required materials.

gurmukhi: rwjsUie krih lgy sB Drm ko icq cwie ]1]142]
transliteration: Raajse Karah(i) Lage Sabh Dharam Ko Chit Chaae||1||142||
translation: Thus, the Rajsu sacrifice began to be performed with religious zeal.1.142.
